00053 void KillHandler(int sig)
00054 {
00055   EthernetShutdown(&ethernet_config);

00057 
00058 void EthernetInputHandler(int sig)
00059 {
00060   static int n=0;
00061   fd_set read_fds;
00062   struct timeval to;
00063   int rc;
00064 
00065 
00066   while (1) {
00067     /* either reader, writer, or both have something for us */
00068     FD_ZERO(&read_fds);
00069     FD_SET(ethernet_reader_fd,&read_fds);
00070     FD_SET(ethernet_writer_fd,&read_fds);
00071 
00072     to.tv_sec=0;
00073     to.tv_usec=0;
00074 
00075     do {
00076       rc = select(MAX(ethernet_reader_fd,ethernet_writer_fd)+1,
00077                   &read_fds, 0, 0, &to);
00078     } while (rc<0 && errno==EINTR);
00079 
00080     if (rc<0) {
00081       PERROR();
00082       exit(-1);
00083     } else if (rc==0) {
00084       /* nothing to do, time out */
00085       return;
00086     } else if (rc>0) {
00087       if (FD_ISSET(ethernet_reader_fd,&read_fds)) {
00088         EthernetIncomingPacket.Unserialize(ethernet_reader_fd);
00089         EthernetIncomingPacketsAvailable=1;
00090         ethernet_config.ISR(ethernet_config.device,
00091                             ETHERNET_SERVICE_PACKET_READY);
00092         DEBUGPRINTF(5,"read packet %d\n",n++);
00093       }
00094 #if ETHERNET_WRITER_ON
00095       if (FD_ISSET(ethernet_writer_fd,&read_fds)) {
00096         int flag;
00097         if (readall(ethernet_writer_fd,
00098                     (char*)&flag,sizeof(flag),0,1)!=sizeof(flag)) {
00099           PERROR();
00100           exit(-1);
00101         }
00102         ethernet_config.ISR(ethernet_config.device,flag);
00103         DEBUGPRINTF(5,"write response - %s\n",
00104                 flag==ETHERNET_SERVICE_OUTPUT_BUFFER_FULL ? "OUTPUT_BUFFER_FULL" :
00105                 flag==ETHERNET_SERVICE_DMA_DONE ? "DMA_DONE" :
00106                 flag==ETHERNET_SERVICE_DMA_FAIL ? "DMA_FAIL" :
00107                 "unknown");
00108       }
00109 #endif
00110     }
00111   }
00112 }

00115 int EthernetStartInternal()
00116 {
00117   /*
00118     Note the use of socketpair here is because linux does not
00119     support async i/o on pipes.  Real OSes do.
00120   */
00121 
00122   struct sigaction sa;
00123   memset(&sa,0,sizeof(sa));
00124   sa.sa_handler=EthernetInputHandler;
00125   sigaction(ETHERNET_SIGNAL,&sa,0);
00126 
00127   if (socketpair(AF_UNIX,SOCK_STREAM,0,ethernet_reader_pair)) {
00128     PERROR();
00129     return -1;
00130   }
00131 
00132   ethernet_reader_fd=ethernet_reader_pair[0];
00133 
00134   ethernet_reader_pid=fork();
00135 
00136   if (ethernet_reader_pid<0) {
00137     /* fork failed */
00138     PERROR();
00139     close(ethernet_reader_pair[0]);
00140     close(ethernet_reader_pair[1]);
00141     return -1;
00142   } else if (ethernet_reader_pid==0) {
00143     /* I am child */
00144     //AttachDebuggerHere("/home/pdinda/netclass/stack++/ISR");
00145     //BreakHere();
00146     close(ethernet_reader_pair[0]);
00147     if (dup2(ethernet_reader_pair[1],fileno(stdout))<0) {
00148       PERROR();
00149       exit(-1);
00150     }
00151     if (dup2(ethernet_reader_pair[1],fileno(stdin))<0) {
00152       PERROR();
00153       exit(-1);
00154     }
00155     DEBUGPRINTF(2,"Starting reader - exec '%s %s %s'\n",READER_ARGS[0],READER_ARGS[1],READER_ARGS[2]);
00156     execv(READER_BINARY,READER_ARGS);
00157     PERROR();
00158     exit(-1);
00159   } else {
00160     /* I am parent */
00161     close(ethernet_writer_pair[1]);
00162     if (socketpair(AF_UNIX,SOCK_STREAM,0,ethernet_writer_pair)) {
00163       PERROR();
00164       kill(ethernet_reader_pid,SIGKILL);
00165       close(ethernet_reader_fd);
00166       return -1;
00167     }
00168     ethernet_writer_fd=ethernet_writer_pair[0];
00169 
00170     ethernet_writer_pid=fork();
00171 
00172     if (ethernet_writer_pid<0) {
00173       /* fork failed */
00174       PERROR();
00175       kill(ethernet_reader_pid,SIGKILL);
00176       close(ethernet_reader_fd);
00177       close(ethernet_writer_pair[0]);
00178       close(ethernet_writer_pair[1]);
00179       return -1;
00180     } else if (ethernet_writer_pid==0) {
00181       /* I am child */
00182       //AttachDebuggerHere("/home/pdinda/netclass/stack++/ISR");
00183       //BreakHere();
00184       close(ethernet_writer_pair[0]);
00185       if (dup2(ethernet_writer_pair[1],fileno(stdout))<0) {
00186         PERROR();
00187         exit(-1);
00188       }
00189       if (dup2(ethernet_writer_pair[1],fileno(stdin))<0) {
00190         PERROR();
00191         exit(-1);
00192       }
00193       DEBUGPRINTF(2,"Starting writer - exec '%s %s %s'\n",WRITER_ARGS[0],WRITER_ARGS[1],WRITER_ARGS[2]);
00194 
00195       execv(WRITER_BINARY,WRITER_ARGS);
00196       PERROR();
00197       exit(-1);
00198     } else {
00199       /* I am parent */
00200       close(ethernet_writer_pair[1]);
00201     }
00202 
00203     return 0;
00204   }
00205 }

00207 
00208 int EthernetShutdownInternal()
00209 {
00210   signal(ETHERNET_SIGNAL,SIG_DFL);
00211   kill(ethernet_reader_pid,SIGKILL);
00212   kill(ethernet_writer_pid,SIGKILL);
00213   close(ethernet_reader_fd);
00214   close(ethernet_writer_fd);
00215   return 0;
00216 }

00218 
00219 int EthernetStartup(EthernetConfig *conf)
00220 {
00221   int rc;
00222 
00223   assert(ethernet_inited==0);
00224   assert(conf!=NULL);
00225   assert(conf->device==0);
00226   assert(conf->flags==0);
00227 
00228   ethernet_config=*conf;
00229 
00230   rc=EthernetStartInternal();
00231 
00232   if (rc<0) {
00233     return rc;
00234   }
00235 
00236   EthernetIncomingPacketsAvailable=0;
00237   EthernetOutgoingPacketsAvailable=0;
00238 
00239   ethernet_inited=1;
00240 
00241   return rc;
00242 
00243 }
00244 
00245 int EthernetShutdown(EthernetConfig *conf)
00246 {
00247   assert(ethernet_inited==1);
00248   assert(conf!=NULL);
00249   assert(conf->device==0);
00250   assert(conf->flags==0);
00251 
00252   EthernetIncomingPacketsAvailable=0;
00253   EthernetOutgoingPacketsAvailable=0;
00254   return EthernetShutdownInternal();
00255 }

00257 
00258 int EthernetGetNextPacket(EthernetConfig *conf, RawEthernetPacket *p)
00259 {
00260   assert(ethernet_inited==1);
00261   assert(conf!=NULL);
00262   assert(conf->device==0);
00263   assert(conf->flags==0);
00264 
00265   if (EthernetIncomingPacketsAvailable<=0) {
00266     return -1;
00267   }
00268 
00269   *p=EthernetIncomingPacket;
00270 
00271   EthernetIncomingPacketsAvailable--;
00272 
00273   return p->size;
00274 }
00275 
00276 
00277 int EthernetWriteNextPacket()
00278 {
00279   int rc=0;
00280 
00281   assert(EthernetOutgoingPacketsAvailable>0);
00282 
00283   EthernetOutgoingPacket.Serialize(ethernet_writer_fd);
00284 
00285   EthernetOutgoingPacketsAvailable--;
00286 
00287   DEBUGPRINTF(5,"Finished ethernetwritenextpacket\n");
00288 
00289   return rc;
00290 
00291 }

00293 
00294 int EthernetInitiateSend(EthernetConfig *conf, RawEthernetPacket *p)
00295 {
00296   assert(ethernet_inited==1);
00297   assert(conf!=NULL);
00298   assert(conf->device==0);
00299   assert(conf->flags==0);
00300 
00301   assert(EthernetOutgoingPacketsAvailable==0);
00302   EthernetOutgoingPacket=*p;
00303   EthernetOutgoingPacketsAvailable=1;
00304 
00305   return EthernetWriteNextPacket();
00306 }

00343 void EthernetAddr::SetToString(const EthernetAddrString s)
00344 {
00345   int i,j;
00346 
00347   for (i=0,j=0;i<6;i++,j+=3) {
00348     hexbytetobyte(&(s[j]),&(addr[i]));
00349   }
00350 
00351 }
00352 
00353 void EthernetAddr::GetAsString(EthernetAddrString s) const
00354 {
00355   int i,j;
00356 
00357   for (i=0,j=0;i<6;i++,j+=3) {
00358     bytetohexbyte(addr[i],&(s[j]));
00359     if (i<5) {
00360       s[j+2]=':';
00361     } else {
00362       s[j+2]=0;
00363     }
00364   }
00365 }

00377 void EthernetAddr::Serialize(const int fd) const
00378 {
00379   if (writeall(fd,addr,6)!=6) {
00380     throw SerializationException();
00381   }
00382 }
00383 
00384 void EthernetAddr::Unserialize(const int fd)
00385 {
00386   if (readall(fd,addr,6)!=6) {
00387     throw SerializationException();
00388   }
00389 }

00441 std::ostream & EthernetHeader::Print(std::ostream &os) const
00442 {

00444   EthernetProtocol proto;
